result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superAgency.name: District Attorney
superAgency.notes:
The defendant will attend a mental health assessment with a qualified professional approved by the DA's office within 90 days....
The defendant shall follow all recommendations of each professional for the term of this agreement....
The defendant will have no further contacts w/law enforcement during term of agrmt. that give rise to probable cause for arrest...
The defendant will have no contact with BMB or SAW except incidental at school or school-related events.
The defendant will not reside with SAW's family
The defendant shall notify the Clerk of Court and the District Attorney's Office of any change of address within 48 hours.
See Deferred JOC for complete agrmt.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Adrina M. Haanen-Pasek

defendant.name: Haanen-Pasek, Adrina M.
defendant.address: E3183 County Rd P, Menomonie, WI 54751

records.addlTxt:
No unsupervised contact with any minor under the age of 16 outside a school setting.   
No contact with BMB except for incidental at school or school related-events.

11:47 AM Defendant Adrina M. Haanen-Pasek in court.  Attorney Ryan Joseph Raymond in court for Adrina M. Haanen-Pasek.  Attorney Joseph M. Schieffer appeared by zoom technology by video for State of Wisconsin. Agreement reached, deferred judgment of conviction agreement and present to court.  There is one handwritten correction on the deferred judgment with Mr. Schieffer's permission.  You would have to attend a mental health assessemnt within 90 days.  And that's the handwritten correction?  Mr. Schieffer agrees been agreed to, yes.  Ms. Haanen-Pasek confirms agreement.  Agreement says Pierce Co.  Mr. Schieffer confirms s/b Pepin Co.  Court orally amends location to Pepin Co. with no objection.  Court advises of charge/max. penalties and confirms name of victim 2.  Agreement you will plead guilty to that charge and count 1 will be DRI.  Court will defer accepting your plea for a period of 1 year from today; attend mental health assessment within 90 days which is the handwritten amendment; follow recommendation of assessment; no further contact with law enforcement to give rise for probable cause for arrest; no contact with BMB or SAW except for incidental at school or school related-events; not reside with SAW's family.  If you can follow those terms of the agreement, then at the end, the matter would be dismissed.   If you fail to do so the state would have the option to ask me to revoke the agreement, accept your plea and we will proceed to sentencing without trial based on your plea.  Court reviews constitutional rights with defendant.  Mr. Raymond satisfied factual basis within the complaint.  Court finds KVI waiving constitutional rights and there is a factual basis for plea.  Defendant pleads guilty to count 2.  Court defers acceptance for a period of 1 year and approve the contract.  DRI count 1.  State has complied with victim rights with no response from one victim and the other victim was supportive of the agreement.  Mr. Raymond, bond will remain in effect, ask the no unsupervised contact with any minor under the age of 16 be limited to outside school setting so she may return to school and the no contact with BMB be consistent with the agreement.  No contact with BMB except for incidental at school or school related-events.  Bond will be changed to reflect those changes.

3:42 PM Defendant Adrina M. Haanen-Pasek in court with Attorney Ryan Joseph Raymond by zoom technology by video.  Attorney Joseph M. Schieffer appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Schieffer had conversations with Attorney Raymond and ask a PLEAS be scheduled.  Attorney Raymond asks the sooner the better and in person.  Mr. Schieffer would like to appear via zoom for the hearing.  Approved.  Mr. Raymond and Ms. Haanen-Pasek will appear in person.  Mr. Raymond updates Ms. Haanen-Pasek's address:  E3183 County Rd P, Menomonie, WI  54751.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 4, 2022 at 11:30 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on October 4, 2022 at 11:30 am.

1:36 PM Defendant Adrina M Haanen-Pasek in courtroom. Attorney Joseph Schieffer appeared by video as Special Prosecutor.  Court advises of charges/max. penalties and rights.  Given Ms. Haanen-Pasek's age, his father addresses the Court.  Defendant addresses the court.  On May 26 there was a bail hearing and a signature bond was signed.  If Dad wants the Court to place you somewhere I can't do that, you are an adult.  There other juvenile proceedings you can pursue regarding where she can live but they are outside this court's jurisdiction.  Have you contacted the PD office?  I did but there was no complaint so they couldn't represent me.  Complaint then filed.  She will be represented by the Eau Claire PD office.  New date set, counsel by zoom.  Bond conditions are still in effect and Ms. Haanen-Pasek to appear in person.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for August 2, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Adjourned initial appearance on August 2, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
